009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * A hand-crafted linear filter for demo purposes only.
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public class Filter_Arbitrary implements PlugInFilter {
021
022    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
023        return DOES_8G;
024    }
025
026    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
027        int M = ip.getWidth();
028        int N = ip.getHeight();
029        
030        // arbitrary filter matrix of size (2K + 1) x (2L + 1):
031        int[][] H = {
032            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0},
033            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
034            {1,1,1,1,1,1,1},
035            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
036            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0}};
037        
038        double s = 1.0 / 23;    // scale factor (sum of filter coefficients is 23)
039        
040        // H[L][K] is the center element of H:
041        int K = (H[0].length - 1) / 2;  // x-center of kernel H
042        int L = (H.length - 1) / 2;             // Y-center of kernel H
043        
044        ImageProcessor copy = ip.duplicate();
045
046        for (int u = K; u <= M - K - 1; u++) {
047                for (int v = L; v <= N - L - 1; v++) {
048                // compute filter result for position (u, v):
049                int sum = 0;
050                for (int i = -K; i <= K; i++) {
051                        for (int j = -L; j <= L; j++) {
052                                                int p = copy.getPixel(u + i, v + j);
053                                                int c = H[j + L][i + K];
054                        sum = sum + c * p;
055                    }
056                }
057                int q = (int) Math.round(s * sum);
058                // clamp result:
059                if (q < 0)   q = 0;
060                if (q > 255) q = 255;
061                ip.putPixel(u, v, q);
062            }
063        }
064    }
065
066}
